instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no audio (no chime, no audio devices detected)
threads.message:
No chime. MacOS will not detect any audio devices (settings no mic/in/out). 

Where do start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no audio (no chime, no audio devices detected)
threads.message:
Any history available?
Check <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> power rails; start with <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no audio (no chime, no audio devices detected)
threads.message:
Other than sound. Everything else seems to be ok so far.

<CAPACITOR>C6411</CAPACITOR> got knocked off and <CHIP>U6410</CHIP> seems to have a little chip around the corner (at pin1)

<CHIP>U6200</CHIP>:
pin 1 (<SIGNAL>PP4V5_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL>) = 4.5v
pin 3 (<SIGNAL>4V5_NR</SIGNAL>) = 1.2v
pin 4 (<SIGNAL>4V5_REG_EN</SIGNAL>) = 3.3v
pin 6 (<SIGNAL>4V5_REG_IN</SIGNAL>) = 5.1v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL> - 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_AUDIO_AMP_L</SIGNAL> - 5.1v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_AUDIO_XW</SIGNAL> - 5.1v

L6300 = 1.5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no audio (no chime, no audio devices detected)
threads.message:
Check resistors and traces between PCH and audio coedec; like <RESISTOR>R6331</RESISTOR>, etc.
If all good, change <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no audio (no chime, no audio devices detected)
threads.message: checked <RESISTOR>R6331</RESISTOR>. <RESISTOR>R1310</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1311</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1312</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1313</RESISTOR> they are all good. Is there any other that I missed that I should check before changing <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no audio (no chime, no audio devices detected)
threads.message:
Change it now.
Be sure to get good solders...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no audio (no chime, no audio devices detected)
threads.message: sorry to dig up this old thread. I have changed the <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> but it still the same...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no audio (no chime, no audio devices detected)
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no audio (no chime, no audio devices detected)
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no audio (no chime, no audio devices detected)
threads.message:
If audio codec is still not detected, then bad chip/solders.
Also check all resistors and traces from its area; even on the other board side.
